trg_text: Cabinet s position on prominent issues in the current environmentCabinet welcomed the Goldman Sachs report, Two Decades of Freedom, which is a detailed account of 10 areas in which South Africa has made structural advances since 1994 and 10 areas in which the country has to take decisive actio	The report is welcome confirmation of government s own assessment of the performance of the country and it affirms the priorities for the future set out in the National Development Pla	The report is a source of hope and inspiration and is an important contribution to public discourse at a time when South Africa has begun celebrating 20 Years of Freedo	Government urges South Africans to work together and work hard to make South Africa even more successful and to concentrate their energies and conversations on these issue	Cabinet welcomes the establishment of two new universities in the Northern Cape and Mpumalanga, the first to be built since the advent of democrac The Mpumalanga University will open in January 2014.

src_text: omela yunibesithi le set haba sa yonAfrika Borwa e gatet e pele kudu kabelong ya ditirelo le diinstit hu ene t e mpsha dit habeng t a go hloka le go phaelwa thok Tshenyo ya diinstit hu ene t eo e bu et a morago dipoelo t e kgolo t e re di fihlelet ego mehleng ya temokrasi ya rena ye mpsh Gape Kabinete e amogela tsebi o ya gore dipolante t a mohlagase t a Eskom Kusile le Medupi di tla aba mohlagase ka 2014.Go fehla mohlagase ngwaga wo o tlago ka dipolante t a mohlagase t a Kusile le Medupi e tla ba katlego ye nngwe ye kgolo ya tlhabollo ya naga gomme e tla laet a katlego ya mmu o phethagat ong ya lenaneo la tlhabollo ya mananeokgoparara ka bont i yeo e bopagoleswa ekonomi le set haba sa renEnet i ya go lotega e bohlokwa go badiri i ba intasteri le ba ka malapeng gomme e bula dikgonagalo t e diswa t a go godi a ekonomi
trg_text: The generating of electricity next year by Kusile and Medupi power plants will be another major milestone for the country s development and will demonstrate government s success in implementing a large-scale infrastructure development programme which is reshaping our economy and societSustainable energy is vital for domestic and industrial customers and opens up new possibilities for growing the economy

src_text: Ka diprot eke t e nt int i t a mohuta wo t e di t welago pele go dikologa naga, Afrika Borwa e t eere dikgato t a go balega t e bohlokwa gotee le mokgwa wa yona wo moswa wa kgolo, gomme maAfrika Borwa ka moka a swanela go keteka dikatlego t a ren Kabinete e tumi a go saenelwa ga Kwano ka ga Prot eke ya Mohlagase wa Meetse ya Grand Inga, ke Mopresidente Jacob Zuma malobanyana ge a be a le Ketelong ya Semmu o go la Repabliki ya Temokrasi ya Cong Prot eke ye e tla oket a phihlelelo ya mohlagase mo Afrika ebile e na le mehola ye ment i go t a temo, meepo le makala a mangwe ka seleteng sa Dinaga t e di Hlabologago t a Borwa bja Afrika (SADC).Ge dikgato ka moka di felelet e, prot eke e tla tli a mohlagase wa go tso olo wa go seripa sa kontinente ya Afrik Prot eke ye e tla hlohlelet a tlholo ya me omo, tlhabollo ya mabokgoni le pheti et o ya theknolot i dinageng t e di kgathago tema gomme e tla hola ba omi i ba intasteri le ba ka malapen Se se bohlokwa kgolong ya ekonomi le bophadi anong go kgabaganya selete sa SAD Kabinete e hlohlelet a maAfrika Borwa ka moka, kudu ba bannyane le bakgethi ba go tlo thoma, go phethagat a tokelo ya bona ya temokrasi ka go t ea kgato ya mathomo ya go ingwadi et a dikgetho ka la 9 le 10 Dibatsela 2013.Ntwa ya rena ya tokologo e

trg_text: Our struggle for freedom secured the right for every South African to be active participants in our democratic syste We call on all South Africans to honour our history and to continue to strengthen the legitimacy of our democrac	Cabinet calls all voters to ensure the 2014 elections achieve a large voter turnout, as we have seen in every election since 1994.

src_text: alet ego morago go romela dipego t a bona t a mot helo gore la 22 Dibatsela 2013 ke let at i la mafelelo la batho la go romela dipego t a mot helo ka elektroniki gobane ngwaga wa mot helo wa 2012/13 o batamela ka lebel Kabinete e kgala ka bogale leuba la bjale la dikgaruru, tshenyo ya dithoto t a praebete le t a set haba le go thopa diphahlo go la Gauteng, Kapa Bohlabela le Kapa Bodikel Kabinete e tumi a maphodisa ge a tsene bogare le go fedi a dikgarurTshenyo ya thoto ya set haba e tima dit haba ditirelo t a set haba t e di nyakwago kudu gomme e hlola morwalo wa tlalelet o wa go fapo a methopo o bu et a le go mpshafat a ditirelo t Mmu o o ka se dumelele basenyi go senya meago le ditlabakelo fao ditirelo t a bohlokwa di abjag Tshenyo ya ka boomo ga e thu e motho, gomme ga go kwagale go senya tirelo ye nngwe go kgopela ye nngwDit haba di swanet e go lwant ha maiteko a basenyi a go thibela thuto ya bana ba rena ka go t ho et a go hlakahlakanya ditlhahlobRe swanet e go aga dit haba fao re hlomphanago le go thu ana, go ena le go t haban Kabinete e laedit e hlobaelo ka dipego set habeng mabapi le Majuda a Afrika Borw Kabinete e amogela tokelo ya batho ba Palestina ya boipu o le tokelo ya Israele ya go ba ka lehlakoreng la pu o ya Palestin Maiteko a bona a go hwet a tharollo ya thulano yeo e tla bago ya toka a swanela go t wela pel Set haba sa Majuda sa Afrika Borwa ga se a swanela go t hoga sel Mmu o ga se o beye kilet o maetong a go ya Israele ka bahlankedi ba mmu Kabinete e amogela dikatlego t a baatlete ba Afrika Borwa bao ba bego ba phadi ana malobanyana go Lebelo le le Telele la Toropokgolo ya New York, moo Moatlelete wa Bodit habat haba wa Mogolofadi Ernst van Dyk a t wilego maemong a bobedi ka karolong ya setulothethi sa bagolofadi, mola Lusapho April a t wilego maemong a boraro ka legorong la lebelo la bao ba senago bogole la bann Go tlalelet a, Don Oliver le Abraham Mouton ba fedit e gare ga ba 60 ba mathomo ka karolong ya dibaesekele t a diatla
trg_text: Cabinet condemns the recent spate of violence, destruction of private and public properties and looting of goods in Gauteng, the Eastern Cape and Western Cap Cabinet commends the police for intervening and quelling the situatio	The destruction of public property deprives communities of much-needed public services and creates the additional burden of resources being diverted to restore and replace these service	Government will not allow criminals to destroy structures and amenities where vital services are rendere Vandalism helps no-one, and there is no logic to destroying one service in the course of demanding anothe	Communities should fight all attempts by criminal elements to take the education of our children hostage by threatening to disrupt examinationWe should build communities where we respect and help each other, rather than fear one anothe
